intro: Randia cubana, commonly known as Cuban randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or red when mature. Randia cubana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
